channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-16317] revert all ESAPI changes
item.description:
to unblock releases, we'll start cleaning up the category-x problem by reverting all the ESAPI changes.

we should try to include a release note with what this means we'll be vulnerable to.

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: You read my mind Sean Busbey. Mind if I pick this one up while you work through the build side?
fine by me. I'll just wait to pull the change in locally so that I can verify the build fails.

Looks like we have to unwind all of HBASE-15122, HBASE-15270, HBASE-15329, and HBASE-15369 from master, a bunch of Samir Ahmic's good work.

Patch for master.
Nick Dimiduk, Sean Busbey feel free to revert and them we can reopen this issues and find solution without ESAPI deps. This are mainly UI minor fixes that we can live with.

-1 overall

+1, presuming an appropriate release note.
Nick Dimiduk / Samir Ahmic can y'all make sure I got everything on HBASE-16328 once this is closed?
Sure thing i will check list and re-test UI to see is all there regarding JIRA-s i was working on.
Sean Busbey feel free to edit this release note to your liking.
Pushed to all branches.

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue: This issue reverts fixes designed to prevent malicious content from rendering in HBase's UIs. Specifically, these changes shipped in 1.1.4+ and 1.2.0+. They were removed due to licensing issues discovered in the dependencies they introduced. Their implementation and those dependencies have been removed from HBase! Removal of these dependencies is against the strict definition of our version compatibility guidelines. However, inclusion of non-Apache approved licenses cannot be tolerated. Implementation of these fixes using an Apache-appropriate means is tracked in HBASE-16328.
